attributes.action: End the need for a fit note every 6 months for permanently disabled people.
attributes.additional_details: There are 16.1 million people in the UK Ringsted Disabled. Every 6 months they have to ask for a fit note from the NHS for there Universal Credit claim. Each case takes 1-5 minuets acuminating 1,333,330 Hrs of NHS Time. This would greatly cut back on wasted time and expense on the NHS.
attributes.background: End the need for a fit note every 6 months for permanently disabled people to reduce the time and cost on the NHS

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

Fit notes are issued if a health condition or disability affects a persons capability to work for longer than 7 days. Fit notes are based on an assessment by a healthcare professional, who decide the length of a fit note based on their clinical judgement.

If a health condition or disability affects capability to work for longer than 28 days, a Work Capability Assessment can be carried out. 

You can find more information on Work Capability Assessments and Universal Credit at:

https://www.citizensadvice.org.uk/benefits/universal-credit/if-youre-sick-or-disabled/going-to-your-universal-credit-medical-assessment/ 

https://www.gov.uk/health-conditions-disability-universal-credit

There is also a similar petition relating to PIP assessment which you may wish to sign: 

Stop DWP repeating PIP assessments for disabled people
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/703827
